content.description: This is one of the longest routes found at the cliff.  Face climb up and left past bolts to a fixed anchor.
content.location:
A little left of the

Coyote's Tooth

.  Starts on the right side of the tall face.

content.description: The name says it all to describe this wide crack climb that ends at the large ledge system.
content.location:
A little to the right of the

Coyote's Tooth

.

content.description: A short left-facing crack leads to steep face climbing past bolts and finishes at a shared fixed anchor.
content.location:
About 50 feet left of the

Coyote's Tooth

.  Starts on the left side of the tall face.

content.description: Climb the corner and crack and then hand traverse right and make a mantle move (crux).  Finish up and left.
content.protection: two or three bolts plus cams 1" to 3"
content.location: Start in the dihedral just left of Fringe Central.

content.description: A short crack route that climbs to the large ledge system.  A second pitch can be done by scrambling up and right to a short hand crack (5.10a).
content.location:
A couple hundred feet right of the

Coyote's Tooth

.  First route to the left of the

Black Arete

.

content.description:
This is the thin crack left of

Ichabod

directly below the pin/bolt anchor.

Start up a slabby face 5.8-9 to a 5.10d crux through the crack to the anchor.  Protection at the crux is a bit slim.

This fine crack leads to the top of the cliff, but only the first two pitches are worth doing.  The third is choss.

Look for a two bolt anchor (there are not many) with an angling crack to the right.  This is the start.

Pitch 1: 40 feet, 5.10b/c.  Start on 5.8 terrain to a nice, thin, hand crack finish.  The 5.10b/c is only a few moves near the top and protects very well.  1 bolt, 1 pin anchor.

Pitch 2: 60 feet, 5.8.  Continue up the featured crack with fun pockets.  Near the top it is extremely loose.  2 bolt anchor.  Did I mention super loose?

Pitch 3: 40 feet, 5.6-7?  I didn't do this pitch, but looking at the garbage on the ledge before the final headwall, it didn't seem worth it.

A 60m rope will be just enough rope to rappel from the top of the second pitch.
content.protection: A standard trad rack and a helmet.
content.location:
It is 150 feet to the left of

Coyote's Tooth

.

content.description:
From the right base of the

Coyote's Tooth

ascend the arête (crux) to a smooth slab. Continue up the slab to the overhang. Move left over the overhang on good jugs to a stance. Continue up over a bulge past an old bolt to the anchors.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor, gear between bolts 6 & 7: a 1.5-2" cam to place at the overhang jugs, and additional 1.5-2" cams above the overhang will avoid 5.9 R without gear.
content.location:
Start behind the right side of the

Coyote's Tooth

.

content.description: Just to the left of an unnamed route in a right-facing corner, climb the arete past 5 bolts to a bolt/chockstone anchor. A second pitch can be done by traversing right and up along the ledge system at the top of the route to reach a short hand crack that goes at 5.10a.
content.location: This is near the center of the cliff.

climbs.name: Ghost Boy
climbs.fa: Kyle Edmondson?; bolted by Justin Putnam

content.description: Ghost Boy is a surprisingly good little climb protected by 5 bolts with sustained climbing from bolts 2-5. The crux comes at the 4th to 5th bolts. The rock is better than expected. I doubt any significant holds will break, although a few may crumble. I believe it to be an old, abandoned project and was told the intended name. I'm guessing my ascent was first, but if not I will change it.
content.location: On the far right side of the cliff, it ascends the obvious, overhanging arete. You can get to the top from the neighboring 11a with a few shenanigans.

content.description: Climb the face past three bolts to a fixed anchor.
content.location: Far right side of the cliffs.

content.protection: Three bolts plus a 3 to 4" cam
content.location: This is about 10 feet left of  the bolted arete of Fringe Dweller.

content.description:
The Coyote's Tooth is the detached flake that sits just left of the center of the wall.  Climb the right edge of the flake past one bolt to a bolted anchor.

A couple TRs can be done from the anchor.

1 - West Arete (5.11)

2 - North Face (5.10).
content.location: Look for the detached 30 foot tall flake that is left of center of the cliff.

content.description: Climb the arete past two bolts to the large ledge system.
content.location:
A couple hundred feet right of the

Coyote's Tooth

.  First route right of

Kuntz

.

content.description:
Just to the left of

Ichabod Direct

and

Ichabod

is a large crack.  This is the route.

Climb the large crack to a sandy mantle.  After the mantle, traverse right 10 feet to the pin/bolt anchor.  The crux would be the mantle move and the crack goes at 5.6.

This route makes a gentle start to the second pitch of

Ichabod

.

This is the 5.8 dihedral just to the right (north) of the

Green Arete

.  The start is a little chossy, but once through the initial moves, this crack offers good laybacks, hand jams, and a fine finger finish.  Once at the top of the crack, traverse on a loose poop covered ledge to the anchors for

Green Arete

.
content.protection: Larger gear.  BD #0.75-3 with a size #4 optional.
